text: is a subway station on the Osaka Metro Midosuji Line in Abeno-ku, Osaka, Japan. ==Layout== There are two side platforms with two tracks underground. {|table border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=3 |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=50 valign=top|G |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=100 valign=top|Street Level |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=500 valign=top|Exit/Entrance |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;border- top:solid 1px gray;" width=50 rowspan=5 valign=top|B1F Platform level |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=100 valign=top|Mezzanine |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=500 valign=top|Fare control, station agent, ticket/ICOCA/PiTaPa machines |- |style="border-top:solid 1px gray;border-right:solid 2px black;border- left:solid 2px black;border-bottom:solid 2px black;text-align:center;" colspan=2| |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;" |Platform 1 |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;" |Midosuji Line towards via () → |- |Platform 2 |← Midosuji Line towards via , , and Shin-Ōsaka (Shōwachō) |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;border-top:solid 2px black;border- right:solid 2px black;border-left:solid 2px black;text-align:center;" colspan=2| |- |- |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=50 valign=top|B2F |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;border- top:solid 1px gray;" width=100 valign=top| |style="border-bottom:solid 1px gray;border-top:solid 1px gray;" width=500 valign=top|Crossunder between platforms |} ==Surroundings== *Sharp Corporation Headquarters *Nagaike Park *Nagai Stadium (North) *Tsurugaoka Station (JR West) ==Stations next to Nishitanabe== Category:Osaka Metro stations Category:Railway stations in Japan opened in 1952
